Song of Songs-1-1: 1 Solomon’s Most Wonderful Song. 1 Solomon’s Most Wonderful Song.
Song of Songs-1-2: The Woman to the Man She Loves 2 Cover me with kisses,     for your love is better than wine. for your love is better than wine.
Song of Songs-1-3: 3 Your perfume smells wonderful,     but your name[a] is sweeter than the best perfume. but your name[a] is sweeter than the best perfume.     That is why the young women love you. That is why the young women love you.
Song of Songs-1-4: 4 Take me with you.     Let’s run away. Let’s run away. The king took me into his room. The Women of Jerusalem to the Man We will rejoice and be happy for you.     Remember, your love is better than wine. Remember, your love is better than wine.     With good reason, the young women love you. With good reason, the young women love you.
Song of Songs-1-5: She Speaks to the Women 5 Daughters of Jerusalem,     I am dark and beautiful, I am dark and beautiful,     as black as the tents of Kedar and Salma.[b] as black as the tents of Kedar and Salma.[b]
Song of Songs-1-6: 6 Don’t look at how dark I am,     at how dark the sun has made me. at how dark the sun has made me. My brothers were angry with me.     They forced me to take care of their vineyards, They forced me to take care of their vineyards,     so I could not take care of myself.[c] so I could not take care of myself.[c]
Song of Songs-1-7: She Speaks to Him 7 I love you with all my soul!     Tell me, where do you feed your sheep? Tell me, where do you feed your sheep?     Where do you lay them down at noon? Where do you lay them down at noon? I should come to be with you     or I will be like a hired woman[d] caring for the sheep of your friends. or I will be like a hired woman[d] caring for the sheep of your friends.
Song of Songs-1-8: He Speaks to Her 8 You are such a beautiful woman.     Surely you know what to do. Surely you know what to do. Go, follow the sheep.     Feed your young goats near the shepherds’ tents. Feed your young goats near the shepherds’ tents.
Song of Songs-1-9: 9 My darling, you are more exciting to me     than any mare among the stallions[e] pulling Pharaoh’s chariots.[f] than any mare among the stallions[e] pulling Pharaoh’s chariots.[f]
Song of Songs-1-10: 10 Your cheeks are so beautiful     with those ornaments hanging beside them. with those ornaments hanging beside them. Your neck is so lovely     under that beautiful string of jewels. under that beautiful string of jewels.
Song of Songs-1-11: 11 Let’s make you some more gold jewelry     and decorate it with silver. and decorate it with silver.
Song of Songs-1-12: She Speaks 12 The smell of my perfume reaches out     to the king lying on his couch. to the king lying on his couch.
Song of Songs-1-13: 13 My lover is like the small bag of myrrh around my neck,     lying all night between my breasts. lying all night between my breasts.
Song of Songs-1-14: 14 My lover is like a bunch of henna flowers     near the vineyards of En Gedi. near the vineyards of En Gedi.
Song of Songs-1-15: He Speaks 15 My darling, you are so beautiful!     Oh, you are beautiful! Oh, you are beautiful!     Your eyes are like doves. Your eyes are like doves.
Song of Songs-1-16: She Speaks 16 You are so handsome, my lover!     Yes, and so charming! Yes, and so charming! Our bed is so fresh and pleasant.[g]
Song of Songs-1-17: 17     The beams of our house are cedar. 17     The beams of our house are cedar.     The rafters are fir. The rafters are fir.
Song of Songs-2-1: 2 I am a rose on the plain of Sharon,[a] 2 I am a rose on the plain of Sharon,[a]     a lily[b] in the valleys. a lily[b] in the valleys.
Song of Songs-2-2: He Speaks 2 My darling, among other women,     you are like a lily among thorns! you are like a lily among thorns!
Song of Songs-2-3: She Speaks 3 My lover, among other men,     you are an apple tree among the wild trees in the forest! you are an apple tree among the wild trees in the forest! She Speaks to the Women I enjoy sitting in my lover’s shadow;     his fruit is so sweet to my taste. his fruit is so sweet to my taste.
Song of Songs-2-4: 4 My lover took me to the wine house;     his intent toward me was love. his intent toward me was love.
Song of Songs-2-5: 5 Strengthen me with raisins[c];     refresh me with apples, because I am weak with love.[d] refresh me with apples, because I am weak with love.[d]
Song of Songs-2-6: 6 My lover’s left arm is under my head,     and his right arm holds me. and his right arm holds me.
Song of Songs-2-7: 7 Women of Jerusalem, promise me by the gazelles and wild deer,     don’t awaken love, don’t awaken love,     don’t arouse love, until I am ready.[e] don’t arouse love, until I am ready.[e]
Song of Songs-2-8: She Speaks Again 8 I hear my lover’s voice.     Here it comes, jumping over the mountains, Here it comes, jumping over the mountains,     skipping over the hills. skipping over the hills.
Song of Songs-2-9: 9 My lover is like a gazelle     or a young deer. or a young deer. Look at him standing behind our wall,     staring out the window, staring out the window,     looking through the lattice.[f] looking through the lattice.[f]
Song of Songs-2-10: 10 My lover speaks to me, “Get up, my darling, my beautiful one.     Let’s go away! Let’s go away!
Song of Songs-2-11: 11 Look, winter is past,     the rains have come and gone. the rains have come and gone.
Song of Songs-2-12: 12 The flowers are blooming in the fields.     It’s time to sing![g] It’s time to sing![g]     Listen, the doves have returned. Listen, the doves have returned.
Song of Songs-2-13: 13 Young figs are growing on the fig trees.     Smell the vines in bloom. Smell the vines in bloom. Get up, my darling, my beautiful one.     Let’s go away!” Let’s go away!”
Song of Songs-2-14: He Speaks 14 My dove, hiding in the caves high on the cliff,     hidden here on the mountain, hidden here on the mountain, let me see you,     let me hear your voice. let me hear your voice. Your voice is so pleasant,     and you are so beautiful! and you are so beautiful!
Song of Songs-2-15: She Speaks to the Women 15 Catch the foxes for us—     the little foxes the little foxes that spoil the vineyard.     Our vineyard is now in bloom. Our vineyard is now in bloom.
Song of Songs-2-16: 16 My lover is mine,     and I am his! and I am his! My lover feeds among the lilies,
Song of Songs-2-17: 17     while the day breathes its last breath 17     while the day breathes its last breath     and the shadows run away. and the shadows run away. Turn, my lover,     be like a gazelle or a young deer on the cleft mountains![h] be like a gazelle or a young deer on the cleft mountains![h]
Song of Songs-3-1: She Speaks 3 At night on my bed, 3 At night on my bed,     I look for the man I love. I look for the man I love. I looked for him,     but I could not find him. but I could not find him.
Song of Songs-3-2: 2 I will get up now!     I will go around the city. I will go around the city. In the streets and squares,     I will look for the man I love. I will look for the man I love. I looked for him,     but I could not find him. but I could not find him.
Song of Songs-3-3: 3 The guards patrolling the city found me.     I asked them, “Have you seen the man I love?” I asked them, “Have you seen the man I love?”
Song of Songs-3-4: 4 I had just left the guards     when I found the man I love! when I found the man I love! I held him and would not let him go,     while I took him to my mother’s house, while I took him to my mother’s house,     to the room of one who bore[a] me. to the room of one who bore[a] me.
Song of Songs-3-5: She Speaks to the Women 5 Women of Jerusalem, promise me     by the gazelles and wild deer, by the gazelles and wild deer, don’t awaken love,     don’t arouse love, until I am ready.[b] don’t arouse love, until I am ready.[b]
Song of Songs-3-6: The Women of Jerusalem Speak 6 Who is this woman     coming from the desert[c] coming from the desert[c]     with this large group of people? with this large group of people? The dust rises behind them     like clouds of smoke from burning myrrh and frankincense and other spices.[d] like clouds of smoke from burning myrrh and frankincense and other spices.[d]
Song of Songs-3-7: 7 Look, Solomon’s traveling chair.[e]     There are 60 soldiers guarding it, There are 60 soldiers guarding it,     strong soldiers of Israel. strong soldiers of Israel.
Song of Songs-3-8: 8 All of them are trained fighting men     with their swords at their side, with their swords at their side,     ready for any danger of the night. ready for any danger of the night.
Song of Songs-3-9: 9 King Solomon made a traveling chair for himself.     The wood came from Lebanon. The wood came from Lebanon.
Song of Songs-3-10: 10 The poles were made from silver,     and the supports were made from gold. and the supports were made from gold. The seat was covered with purple cloth.     It was inlaid with love by the women of Jerusalem. It was inlaid with love by the women of Jerusalem.
Song of Songs-3-11: 11 Women of Zion, come out     and see King Solomon. and see King Solomon. See the crown[f] his mother put on him     the day he was married, the day he was married,     the day he was so happy! the day he was so happy!
Song of Songs-4-1: He Speaks to Her 4 My darling, you are so beautiful! 4 My darling, you are so beautiful!     Oh, you are beautiful! Oh, you are beautiful! Your eyes are like doves     under your veil. under your veil. Your hair is long and flowing,     like little goats dancing down the slopes of Mount Gilead. like little goats dancing down the slopes of Mount Gilead.
Song of Songs-4-2: 2 Your teeth are white like ewes[a]     just coming from their bath. just coming from their bath. They all give birth to twins;     not one of them has lost a baby. not one of them has lost a baby.
Song of Songs-4-3: 3 Your lips are like a red silk thread.     Your mouth is beautiful. Your mouth is beautiful. Your cheeks under your veil     are like two slices of pomegranate. are like two slices of pomegranate.
Song of Songs-4-4: 4 Your neck is long and thin     like David’s tower. like David’s tower. That tower was built to be decorated[b]     with a thousand shields on its walls, with a thousand shields on its walls,     with the shields of powerful soldiers. with the shields of powerful soldiers.
Song of Songs-4-5: 5 Your breasts are like twin fawns,     like twins of a gazelle, like twins of a gazelle,     feeding among the lilies. feeding among the lilies.
Song of Songs-4-6: 6 I will go to that mountain of myrrh     and to that hill of frankincense and to that hill of frankincense while the day breathes its last breath,     and the shadows run away. and the shadows run away.
Song of Songs-4-7: 7 My darling, you are beautiful all over.     Every part of you is perfect. Every part of you is perfect.
Song of Songs-4-8: 8 Come with me, my bride, from Lebanon.     Come with me from Lebanon. Come with me from Lebanon. Come from the peak of Amana,[c]     from the top of Senir[d] and Hermon, from the top of Senir[d] and Hermon,     from the lion’s caves, from the lion’s caves,     from the mountain of the leopards. from the mountain of the leopards.
Song of Songs-4-9: 9 My darling,[e] my bride, you excite me!     You have stolen my heart with just one quick look from your eyes, You have stolen my heart with just one quick look from your eyes,     with just one of the jewels from your necklace. with just one of the jewels from your necklace.
Song of Songs-4-10: 10 Your love is so beautiful, my darling, my bride!     Your love is better than wine. Your love is better than wine. The smell of your perfume     is better than any kind of spice! is better than any kind of spice!
Song of Songs-4-11: 11 My bride, your lips drip honey.     Honey and milk are under your tongue. Honey and milk are under your tongue. Your clothes smell as sweet as perfume.[f]
Song of Songs-4-12: 12 My darling, my bride,     you are pure like a locked garden. you are pure like a locked garden. You are like a locked pool,     a closed fountain. a closed fountain.
Song of Songs-4-13: 13 Your limbs are like a garden     filled with pomegranates and other pleasant fruit, filled with pomegranates and other pleasant fruit, with all the best spices:     henna,[g] henna,[g]
Song of Songs-4-14: 14 nard, saffron,[h] calamus,[i] and cinnamon.[j] Your limbs are like a garden     filled with trees of frankincense, myrrh, and aloe. filled with trees of frankincense, myrrh, and aloe.
Song of Songs-4-15: 15 You are like a garden fountain—     a well of fresh water— a well of fresh water—     flowing down from the mountains of Lebanon. flowing down from the mountains of Lebanon.
Song of Songs-4-16: She Speaks 16 Wake up, north wind.     Come, south wind. Come, south wind. Blow on my garden.     Spread its sweet smell. Spread its sweet smell. Let my lover enter his garden     and eat its pleasant fruit. and eat its pleasant fruit.
Song of Songs-5-1: He Speaks 5 My darling my bride, I have entered my garden. 5 My darling my bride, I have entered my garden.     I have gathered my myrrh and spice. I have gathered my myrrh and spice. I have eaten my honey and honeycomb.     I have drunk my wine and milk. I have drunk my wine and milk. The Women Speak to the Lovers Dearest friends, eat, drink!     Be drunk with love! Be drunk with love!
Song of Songs-5-2: She Speaks 2 I am asleep,     but my heart is awake. but my heart is awake. I hear my lover knocking, saying,     “Open to me, my darling, my love, “Open to me, my darling, my love,     my dove, my perfect one! my dove, my perfect one! My head is soaked with dew.     My hair is wet with the mist of the night.” My hair is wet with the mist of the night.”
Song of Songs-5-3: 3 “I have taken off my robe.[a]     I don’t want to put it on again. I don’t want to put it on again. I have washed my feet.     I don’t want to get them dirty again.” I don’t want to get them dirty again.”
Song of Songs-5-4: 4 But my lover put his hand through the opening,[b]     and I felt sorry for him.[c] and I felt sorry for him.[c]
Song of Songs-5-5: 5 I got up to open for my lover,     myrrh dripping from my hands, myrrh dripping from my hands, myrrh scented lotion dripped from my fingers     onto the handles of the lock. onto the handles of the lock.
Song of Songs-5-6: 6 I opened for my lover,     but my lover had turned away and was gone! but my lover had turned away and was gone! I nearly died     when he came and went.[d] when he came and went.[d] I looked for him,     but I couldn’t find him. but I couldn’t find him. I called for him,     but he didn’t answer me. but he didn’t answer me.
Song of Songs-5-7: 7 The guards patrolling the city found me.     They hit me. They hit me.     They hurt me. They hurt me. The guards on the wall     took my robe from me. took my robe from me.
Song of Songs-5-8: 8 I tell you, women of Jerusalem,     if you find my lover, tell him I am weak with love.[e] if you find my lover, tell him I am weak with love.[e]
Song of Songs-5-9: The Women of Jerusalem Answer Her 9 Beautiful woman,     how is your lover different from other lovers? how is your lover different from other lovers? Is your lover better than other lovers?     Is that why you ask us to make this promise? Is that why you ask us to make this promise?
Song of Songs-5-10: She Answers the Women of Jerusalem 10 My lover is tanned and radiant.     He would stand out among 10,000 men. He would stand out among 10,000 men.
Song of Songs-5-11: 11 His head is like the purest gold.     His hair is curly and as black as a raven. His hair is curly and as black as a raven.
Song of Songs-5-12: 12 His eyes are like doves by a stream,     like doves in a pool of milk, like doves in a pool of milk,     like a jewel in its setting. like a jewel in its setting.
Song of Songs-5-13: 13 His cheeks are like a garden of spices,     like flowers used for perfume. like flowers used for perfume. His lips are like lilies,     dripping with liquid myrrh. dripping with liquid myrrh.
Song of Songs-5-14: 14 His arms are like gold rods,     filled with jewels. filled with jewels. His body is like smooth ivory     with sapphires set in it. with sapphires set in it.
Song of Songs-5-15: 15 His legs are like marble pillars     on bases of fine gold. on bases of fine gold. He stands tall     like the finest cedar tree in Lebanon! like the finest cedar tree in Lebanon!
Song of Songs-5-16: 16 Yes, women of Jerusalem, my lover is everything I desire.     His mouth is the sweetest of all. His mouth is the sweetest of all. This is my lover;     this is my darling. this is my darling.
Song of Songs-6-1: The Women of Jerusalem Speak to Her 6 Beautiful woman, 6 Beautiful woman,     where has your lover gone? where has your lover gone? Which way did your lover go?     Tell us so that we can help you look for him. Tell us so that we can help you look for him.
Song of Songs-6-2: She Answers the Women of Jerusalem 2 My lover has gone down to his garden,     where sweet-smelling spices grow. where sweet-smelling spices grow. There, like a sheep, he will eat the grass,     and he will enjoy the lilies. and he will enjoy the lilies.
Song of Songs-6-3: 3 I belong to my lover, and my lover belongs to me.     He is the one feeding among the lilies. He is the one feeding among the lilies.
Song of Songs-6-4: He Speaks to Her 4 My darling, you are as beautiful as Tirzah,[a]     as pleasant as Jerusalem, as pleasant as Jerusalem,     as awesome as the stars in the sky.[b] as awesome as the stars in the sky.[b]
Song of Songs-6-5: 5 Don’t look at me!     Your eyes excite me too much! Your eyes excite me too much! And your hair is long and flowing,     like little goats dancing down the slopes of Mount Gilead. like little goats dancing down the slopes of Mount Gilead.
Song of Songs-6-6: 6 Your teeth are white like ewes[c]     just coming from their bath. just coming from their bath. They all give birth to twins.     Not one of them has lost a baby. Not one of them has lost a baby.
Song of Songs-6-7: 7 Your cheeks under your veil     are like slices of pomegranate. are like slices of pomegranate.
Song of Songs-6-8: 8 There might be 60 queens     and 80 slave women, and 80 slave women,     and young women too many to count, and young women too many to count,
Song of Songs-6-9: 9 but there is only one woman for me,     my dove, my perfect one. my dove, my perfect one. She is the favorite of her mother,     her mother’s favorite child. her mother’s favorite child. The young women see her and praise her.     Even the queens and slave women praise her. Even the queens and slave women praise her.
Song of Songs-6-10: The Women Praise Her 10 Who is that young woman?     She shines out like the dawn. She shines out like the dawn. She is as pretty as the moon.     She is as bright as the sun. She is as bright as the sun. She is as awesome     as the stars in the sky. as the stars in the sky.
Song of Songs-6-11: He Speaks to Her 11 I went down to the grove of walnut trees,     to see the fruit of the valley, to see the fruit of the valley, to see if the vines were in bloom,     to see if the pomegranates had budded. to see if the pomegranates had budded.
Song of Songs-6-12: 12 I was so excited     when she put me in the royal chariot.[d] when she put me in the royal chariot.[d]
Song of Songs-6-13: The Women of Jerusalem Call to Her 13 Come back, come back, Shulamith[e]!     Come back, come back, so we may look at you. Come back, come back, so we may look at you. Why are you staring at Shulamith,     as she dances the Mahanaim dance[f]? as she dances the Mahanaim dance[f]?
Song of Songs-7-1: He Praises Her Beauty 7 Princess,[a] your feet are beautiful in those sandals. 7 Princess,[a] your feet are beautiful in those sandals.     The curves of your thighs are like jewelry made by an artist. The curves of your thighs are like jewelry made by an artist.
Song of Songs-7-2: 2 Your navel is like a round cup[b];     may it never be without wine. may it never be without wine. Your belly is like a pile of wheat     surrounded by lilies. surrounded by lilies.
Song of Songs-7-3: 3 Your breasts are like twin fawns     of a young gazelle. of a young gazelle.
Song of Songs-7-4: 4 Your neck is like an ivory tower. Your eyes are like the pools in Heshbon     near the gate of Bath Rabbim. near the gate of Bath Rabbim. Your nose is like the tower of Lebanon     that looks toward Damascus. that looks toward Damascus.
Song of Songs-7-5: 5 Your head is like Carmel,     and the hair on your head is like silk. and the hair on your head is like silk. Your long flowing hair     captures even a king. captures even a king.
Song of Songs-7-6: 6 You are so beautiful and so pleasant,     a lovely, delightful young woman! a lovely, delightful young woman!
Song of Songs-7-7: 7 You are tall—     as tall as a palm tree. as tall as a palm tree. And your breasts are like     the clusters of fruit on that tree. the clusters of fruit on that tree.
Song of Songs-7-8: 8 I would love to climb that tree     and take hold of its branches. and take hold of its branches. May your breasts be like clusters of grapes     and your fragrance[c] like apples. and your fragrance[c] like apples.
Song of Songs-7-9: 9 May your mouth be like the best wine,     flowing straight to my love, flowing straight to my love,     flowing gently to the sleeper’s lips. flowing gently to the sleeper’s lips.
Song of Songs-7-10: She Speaks to Him 10 I belong to my lover,     and he wants me. and he wants me.
Song of Songs-7-11: 11 Come, my lover,     let’s go out into the field; let’s go out into the field;     let’s spend the night in the villages. let’s spend the night in the villages.
Song of Songs-7-12: 12 Let’s get up early and go to the vineyards.     Let’s see if the vines are in bloom. Let’s see if the vines are in bloom. Let’s see if the blossoms have opened     and if the pomegranates are in bloom. and if the pomegranates are in bloom.     There I will give you my love. There I will give you my love.
Song of Songs-7-13: 13 Smell the mandrakes[d]     and all the pleasant flowers by our door. and all the pleasant flowers by our door. I have saved many pleasant things for you, my lover,     pleasant things, new and old. pleasant things, new and old.
Song of Songs-8-1: 8 If you were a baby, like my little brother nursing at his mother’s breasts, 8 If you were a baby, like my little brother nursing at his mother’s breasts,     and if I found you outside, and if I found you outside, I could kiss you,     and no one would say it was wrong. and no one would say it was wrong.
Song of Songs-8-2: 2 I would lead you into my mother’s house,     to the room of she who taught me. to the room of she who taught me. I would give you spiced wine     squeezed from my pomegranate. squeezed from my pomegranate.
Song of Songs-8-3: She Speaks to the Women 3 His left arm is under my head,     and his right hand holds me. and his right hand holds me.
Song of Songs-8-4: 4 Women of Jerusalem, promise me,     don’t awaken love, don’t awaken love,     don’t arouse love, until I am ready.[a] don’t arouse love, until I am ready.[a]
Song of Songs-8-5: The Women of Jerusalem Speak 5 Who is this woman     coming from the desert, leaning on her lover? coming from the desert, leaning on her lover? She Speaks to Him I woke you under the apple tree,     where your mother gave birth to you, where your mother gave birth to you,     where you were born. where you were born.
Song of Songs-8-6: 6 Keep me near you like a seal you wear over your heart,     like a signet ring you wear on your hand. like a signet ring you wear on your hand. Love is as strong as death.     Passion is as strong as the grave.[b] Passion is as strong as the grave.[b] Its sparks become a flame,     and it grows to become a great fire[c]! and it grows to become a great fire[c]!
Song of Songs-8-7: 7 A flood cannot put out love.     Rivers cannot drown love. Rivers cannot drown love. Would people despise a man for giving     everything he owns for love? everything he owns for love?
Song of Songs-8-8: Her Brothers Speak 8 We have a little sister,     and her breasts are not yet grown. and her breasts are not yet grown. What should we do for our sister     when a man comes asking to marry her? when a man comes asking to marry her?
Song of Songs-8-9: 9 If she were a wall,     we would put silver trim[d] around her. we would put silver trim[d] around her. If she were a door,     we would put a cedar board around her. we would put a cedar board around her.
Song of Songs-8-10: She Answers Her Brothers 10 I am a wall,     and my breasts are my towers. and my breasts are my towers.     And he is satisfied with me![e] And he is satisfied with me![e]
Song of Songs-8-11: He Speaks 11 Solomon had a vineyard at Baal Hamon.     He put men in charge of the vineyard. He put men in charge of the vineyard. Each man brought in grapes     worth 1000 shekels[f] of silver. worth 1000 shekels[f] of silver.
Song of Songs-8-12: 12 Solomon, you can keep your 1000 shekels.     Give 200 shekels to each man for the grapes he brought. Give 200 shekels to each man for the grapes he brought.     But I will keep my own vineyard. But I will keep my own vineyard.
Song of Songs-8-13: He Speaks to Her 13 There you are, sitting in the garden.     Friends are listening to your voice. Friends are listening to your voice.     Let me hear it too! Let me hear it too!
Song of Songs-8-14: She Speaks to Him 14 Hurry, my lover!     Be like a gazelle or a young deer on the mountains of spice. Be like a gazelle or a young deer on the mountains of spice.
